description.english: You have finished exploring the Gatehouse and completed Helia's first quests.
You won the game in Standard Mode.
You won the game in Strategic Mode.
You won the game in Expert Mode.
You survived a nefarious trap meant to kill your party.
You ate some Tavolin, an elvish delicacy. You once enjoyed eating it with your father, Lindorian.
You completed your training with Prater Camden.
You defeated Qutkik, the Kobold Commander. Easy, right?
Your party has been joined by a Paladin from the Order of the Thrush named Sir Galenor.
You have found all the pieces of the mythical Mantle of Ragnor.
You have found the pieces of the Veil of the Dragon. The great Dragonkindt leader Strindelhart's armor.
You have found your Father's special ring. It will bring clarity to the nature of your quest.
You have found the artifact set belonging to a legendary rogue named Xandriel.
You have found a secret portal that goes to Bardain, the Moon of Arieyon. The place where the ancient Alonoi once seeded the world.
You have defeated the aggressive Elder Dendrogant who guarded the Alonoi Citadel on Bardain.
You helped the Enchantress Mira Star to research an ancient tablet on Bardain.
You defeated a fiery Efreet sent to stop you from retrieving your Father's Meldicar Dust by an unknown adversary.
You've finally arrived back home. It is a sad thing your parents can't be there to greet you.
You have found a Treatise written by the legendary Magus Ragnor. It seems to describe something important about how the Tazvoxx was sealed.
You have defeated the Ratkindt warlord who has invaded your family's underground library.
You helped Xanidain Krelos finally put his beloved to rest after many centuries.
The Skeleton Commander, Thorn Greyjaw, no longer blocks passage to the portal in the ancient crypts beneath your Mansion.
You have arrived at the ancient Laboratory of Belacron the Mad. Watch out that his research projects don't give you trouble.
In order to pass into the Realm of the Shadowkindt you had to defeat the Orc Chieftain bound to guard the gate by Samael himself.
You have found your way into realm of Shadow. The eerie denizens do not seem friendly.
Defeated Goranzumoth, one of Samael's former Tusk minions, who was brought back to serve him again as an undead Reaper.
Zexnag, the high priest of the Temple of the Shadow Lord, decided he wanted to protect Kaliopea from justice. You made sure he would not live to regret that mistake.
You have finally defeated Kaliopea, the mastermind behind the murder of your parents and the would-be High Mandate of all Dragonkindt. Rest in pieces, villain.
You have found the holy book of the Dragonkindt, the Tazvoxx. You have fulfilled your father and mother's role as Seekers. Unfortunately, they didn't survive to see it.
You have found all the pages of the Journal of Belacron that your Father has hidden.
You have discovered all the pages that belong to your Father's Kifar. A tragic tale of an ambitious researcher.
You found the Dwarven Triple Crossbow for Tindrin Belrond of the Sentinels.
You have found the pieces of the Shroud of the Divine. Kinet the Just's unique armor.
You have finished exploring the Gatehouse and completed Helia's first quests in Strategic difficulty.
You survived a nefarious trap meant to kill your party in Strategic difficulty. No matter how bad a situation, a good strategy often prevails.
You defeated Qutkik, the Kobold Commander. You had to be a bit strategic.
Your party has been joined by a Paladin from the Order of the Thrush named Sir Galenor. Strategic difficulty.
You have found all the pieces of the mythical Mantle of Ragnor in Strategic difficulty.
You have found the pieces of the Veil of the Dragon in Strategic difficulty. The great Dragonkindt leader Strindelhart's armor.
You have found your Father's special ring in Strategic difficulty. It will bring clarity to the nature of your quest.
You have found the artifact set belonging to a legendary rogue named Xandriel in Strategic difficulty.
You have found a secret portal that goes to Bardain, the Moon of Arieyon in Strategic difficulty. The place where the ancient Alonoi once seeded the world.
You have defeated the aggressive Elder Dendrogant who guarded the Alonoi Citadel on Bardain in Strategic difficulty.
You helped the Enchantress Mira Star to research an ancient tablet on Bardain in Strategic difficulty.
You defeated a fiery Efreet sent to stop you from retrieving your Father's Meldicar Dust by an unknown adversary. Strategic difficulty.
You've finally arrived back home in Strategic difficulty. It is a sad thing your parents can't be there to greet you.

You helped Xanidain Krelos finally put his beloved to rest after many centuries. Strategic difficulty.

You have arrived at the ancient Laboratory of Belacron the Mad in Strategic difficulty. Watch out that his research projects don't give you trouble.

Defeated Goranzumoth, one of Samael's former Tusk minions, who was brought back to serve him again as an undead Reaper. Strategic difficulty.
Zexnag, the high priest of the Temple of the Shadow Lord, decided he wanted to protect Kaliopea from justice. You made sure he would not live to regret that mistake. Strategic difficulty.
You have finally defeated Kaliopea, the mastermind behind the murder of your parents and the would-be High Mandate of all Dragonkindt. Rest in pieces, villain. Strategic difficulty.

You have found the holy book of the Dragonkindt, the Tazvoxx. You have fulfilled your father and mother's role as Seekers. Unfortunately, they didn't survive to see it. A great accomplishment in honor of their memory. Strategic difficulty.

You have finished exploring the Gatehouse and completed Helia's first quests in Expert difficulty.
You survived a nefarious trap meant to kill your party in Expert difficulty. Did you walk into her trap willingly just for the challenge?
You expertly defeated Qutkik, the Kobold Commander. Small fry are no challenge.
Your party has been joined by a Paladin from the Order of the Thrush named Sir Galenor. Expert difficulty.
You have found all the pieces of the mythical Mantle of Ragnor in Expert difficulty.
You have found the pieces of the Veil of the Dragon in Expert difficulty. The great Dragonkindt leader Strindelhart's armor.
You have found your Father's special ring in Expert difficulty. It will bring clarity to the nature of your quest.
You have found the artifact set belonging to a legendary rogue named Xandriel in Expert difficulty.

You have finally defeated Kaliopea, the mastermind behind the murder of your parents and the would-be High Mandate of all Dragonkindt. Rest in pieces, villain. Expert difficulty.

You have found the holy book of the Dragonkindt, the Tazvoxx. You have fulfilled your father and mother's role as Seekers. Unfortunately, they didn't survive to see it. Their legacy is in good claws with you. Expert difficulty.
You have found all the pages of the Journal of Belacron that your Father has hidden in Expert difficulty.
You have discovered all the pages that belong to your Father's Kifar in Expert difficulty. A tragic tale of an ambitious researcher. His legacy is now well protected.
You found the Dwarven Triple Crossbow for Tindrin Belrond of the Sentinels in Expert difficulty. Your versatility may one day be regarded as legendary.
You have found the pieces of the Shroud of the Divine. Kinet the Just's unique armor. Expert difficulty.
As per your promise to your father, you were discerning and only picked up items when appropriate. (25% of all chest items or less)
As per your promise to your father, you were discerning and only picked up items when appropriate. (25% of all chest items or less) Strategic Difficulty.
As per your promise to your father, you were discerning and only picked up items when appropriate. (25% of all chest items or less) Expert Difficulty.
As per your promise to your father, you were steadfast and only picked up items when appropriate. (5% of all chest items or less)
